intro: Humboltia contorta, commonly known as the twisted humboldtia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Humboltia contorta is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in warm, humid climates.
